result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lemar William Howze

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lemar William Howze not in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court for Lemar William Howze.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final Pretrial held. Court holds colloquy with parties.  Case remains in trial posture. Defense counsel requests adjournment of Jury Trial due to victims being unavailable.
Court vacates the 11/7/2022 Jury Trial and ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 30.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Lemar William Howze not in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan appeared by video for Lemar William Howze.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Case adjourned.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Lemar William Howze not in court, in custody.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for status conference.  Defense received discovery, but no offer. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Lemar William Howze not in court, defendant in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Court waived the defendant's appearance. Defendant qualifies for SPD representation but no counsel has been appointed.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with LLK, LK
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lemar William Howze in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Lemar William Howze in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Lemar William Howze not in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/3/22 @ 2p
